RecursiveHierarchy.@Core.Description: Derived information about a node in a hierarchy
RecursiveHierarchy.@Core.LongDescription:
After hierarchical transformations (`ancestors`, `descendants`, `traverse`) are applied to a
          requested resource, the properties of this instance annotation are derived for each node,
          that is, for each instance in the resulting collection.
          They are not affected by subsequent transformations or query options (like `$filter` or `$top`).
          The qualifier of this instance annotation is the one used in the hierarchical transformations.

ExternalKey.@Core.Description: The external key value for a node

NodeType.@Core.LongDescription:
In a recursive hierarchy with mixed types, nodes of different type can have different properties
            and be represented by entities of different subtypes of a commmon entity type.

DescendantCount.@Core.Description: The number of descendants of a node

SiblingRank.@Core.Description: The sibling rank of a node is the index of the node in the sequence of all nodes with the same parent. The first sibling has rank 0.

PreorderRank.@Core.Description: The preorder rank of a node expresses its position in the sequence of nodes created from preorder traversal. The first node in preorder traversal has rank 0.

IsLeaf.@Core.Description: Whether a node has no children in the requested resource

DistanceFromRoot.@Core.Description: The number of edges between the node and the root node

Level.@Core.Description: A node's level, which increases when descending the hierarchy
